poem:
### Phishing in Troubled Waters

In virtual realms, shadows play their game,
A state's cold fingers, cloaked in friends' names,
Reaching through wires, breaching through trust,
Turning steel into rust, bonds into dust.
Civil hearts netted, in their webs of deceit,
Where sanctions and quests for truth discreet,
A pixelated whisper, an unending fight,
In the twilight of data, we seek the light.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Russia launching more sophisticated phishing attacks, new report finds Russia’s state security agency is launching increasingly sophisticated phishing attacks against US, European and Russian civil society members, in some cases by impersonating individuals who are personally close to the targets of the attacks, according to a new investigation by security researchers. A new report by the Citizen Lab at the University of Toronto and Access Now comes as the FBI has separately launched an investigation". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Russia launching more sophisticated phishing attacks, new report finds Russia’s state security agency is launching increasingly sophisticated phishing attacks against US, European and Russian civil society members, in some cases by impersonating individuals who are personally close to the targets of the attacks, according to a new investigation by security researchers. A new report by the Citizen Lab at the University of Toronto and Access Now comes as the FBI has separately launched an investigation
